document_data.mainbody: ''heresy''' was a belief in a given [[deity]] that substantially deviated from the mainstream of that deity's [[church]]. Some of these deviations were tolerated by the deities.

Overview.Rejection: When a deity rejected the new idea, it basically protected the status quo. The church continued to support the ideals it did before the rise of the heresy, but only at the cost of reducing the church's membership as some people who embraced the heresy left the church. Ultimately, this action led to a loss of divine strength for the deity for having less worshipers.
Overview.Doing Nothing: When a deity was faced with the rise of a heresy and did nothing, the people who would have been driven away if the deity rejected the new idea remained in the church. This would allow the deity to have additional worshipers at the cost of a loss of authority if the new idea was one in competition with the old one.
Overview.Support: A deity could support a heresy by declaring it to be the actual truth. This action turned the heresy into the effective truth and thus the new mainstream tenet of the church.

Known Heresies.Cult of Shared Suffering: The Cult of Shared Suffering was a heresy of [[Ilmater]]. The idea behind the belief was that the Crying God's burden could be understood by suffering too.
Known Heresies.Dark Moon heresy: The Dark Moon heresy was the belief that [[Sel√ªne]] and [[Shar]] were not separate deities but different personas of the same deity.
Known Heresies.Risen Sun heresy: The Risen Sun heresy was the belief that [[Lathander]] was not merely the reincarnation of [[Amaunator]] but was also close to becoming the [[Netherese]] god.
Known Heresies.Three-Faced Sun heresy: The Three-Faced Sun heresy was the belief that [[the sun]] was an [[overgod]] with two [[aspect]]s that were eligible as objects of worship.
